content.question: The integral test can be used to conclude that which of the following statements about the infinite series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator n, and denominator n squared, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?

choices.label: The series converges, and the terms of the series have limit 0.
The series diverges, and the terms of the series have limit 0.
The series converges, and the terms of the series do not have limit 0.
The series diverges, and the terms of the series do not have limit 0.

content.answer: The series diverges, and the terms of the series have limit 0.
